recipe.name: Charred Poblano Chilis
recipe.instructions:
1. Turn on an oven broiler
2. Cut the chilies in half lengthwise and remove the stems and seeds.
3. Place ten of the chili halves skin side up on a foil-lined baking sheet and press them down as flat as possible (this insures that they will cook evenly)
4. Put the baking sheet in the oven on the next-to-top rack
5. Cook the chilies in three increments of four minutes each, flipping them over after each four-minute increment
6. Place the hot chilies in a sealed plastic bag for 15 minutes to loosen the skins
7. After the 15 minutes are up, peel the skins off the chilies
NOTE: Ovens vary - adjust the times in step 5 to cook the chilies until the outsides are wrinkled and somewhat blackened, and the meat is completely softened.
ADDITIONAL INFO: Poblano chilies are frequently, but incorrectly, called Pasilla chilies bygrocery stores. Poblanos are a large, dark green, somewhat triangularly-shaped pepper.
